body.p:
To Hon Thomas E. Brambt
Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

Your Petitioner Dilingham Myze represents to you excellency that at the term of the Allen Equity & Criminal Court 1861. there was a Judgament rendered agst him in favor of the Commonwealth of Ky for the sum of Twenty five Dollars ^& costs of Prosecution^ on a charge of a Breach of the peace. He represents that one J. M. Sudusan & Bennett Cannell got into a difficulty and your Petitioner was trying to get them parted & to settle it when one Solomon Calahan made an attack upon him He states that the difficulty was forced upon him as he would not had any difficulty. He states that he is a very poor man with considerable family and can hardly live thru hard times. He has a widowed mother who is depindent upon him to a great extent for a support He had two younger Brothers both of which left his mother & joined the 9th Ky Reg Vol. under Col Grider one of which has since been killed. He asks humbly that your excellency remit that portion of the fine going to the Comth as it is of consideration to him & for which he will ever pray &c.
Sworn to and subscribed before me by Dillingham Mize this 2nd day of November 1863.
William Mansfield Judge of the Allen County Court
